page.title: 01St. Marys Church.
page.content: On the fourteenth of May we decided to go to St.Mary's Church to find out about it for the Domesday Project.The information that we found out was that there has been a parish of Chilton Foliat since before the first Domesday Survey.In 1086 there was a parish divided between Wiltshire and Berksire.The village was called {Cilleton}and meant Cilla's Farm. The Foliat was added after the Norman occupation when the de Foliat family were given the lands to administer in the 13th. century.De Foliat is a Norman nickname meaning "trapper".
